JumpScale.baselib.statmanager package¶

Submodules¶

JumpScale.baselib.statmanager.StatManager module¶

class JumpScale.baselib.statmanager.StatManager.StatManager[source]¶
addInfo(info)[source]¶

can be multi line param:info dotnotation of info e.g. ‘water.white.level.sb 10’ (as used in graphite) result bool

addInfoLine2HistoryObj(id, value, epoch=None)[source]¶
cleanCache()[source]¶
getEpoch()[source]¶
getFiveMinuteId()[source]¶
getHeaders(start, stop)[source]¶

getHourId()[source]¶
getInfo1h(id, start, stop)[source]¶

return raw info (resolution is 1h) param:id id in dot noation e.g. ‘water.white.level.sb’ (can be multiple use comma as separation) param:start epoch; 0 means all param:stop epoch; 0 means all result list(list)

getInfo1hFromTo(id, start, stop)[source]¶

will not return more than 12 months of info, resolution = 1h param:id id in dot noation e.g. ‘water.white.level.sb’ param:start epoch param:stop epoch result dict()

getInfo5Min(id, start=0, stop=0, epoch2human=False)[source]¶

return raw info (resolution is 5min) param:id id in dot noation e.g. ‘water.white.level.sb’ (can be multiple use comma as separation) param:start epoch; 0 means all param:stop epoch; 0 means all result list(list) [[epoch,value],[epoch,value],...]

getInfo5MinFromTo(id, start, stop)[source]¶

will not return more than 1 month of info param:id id in dot noation e.g. ‘water.white.level.sb’ param:start epoch param:stop epoch result list with values

getInfoWithHeaders(id, start, stop, maxvalues)[source]¶

param:id id in dot noation e.g. ‘water.white.level.sb’ (can be multiple use comma as separation) param:start epoch param:stop epoch param:maxvalues nr of values you want to return result list(list)
